body_html: I agree on the goal of getting familiar with git, not sure if this is the right means. Speaking from my experience last year, the first post didn't feel at all like a 'low-risk' environment. As they are doing only 2 blogposts, one very early in the Summer: I am not sure that is the way to ease someone into git. ;-) OTOH, I am very glad that I learned so much git and gh during the summer, and I wouldn't mind if (teaching) git becomes a requirement for project proposals and/or coaching companies.
